file_content.text: Getting better every day. The order's tech is safe here until then.
Your long-lost tech, Padawan Kosh. This should be everything.
It all looks intact. This is even more than we found. The Gormak must have kept searching.
I can't thank you enough for this. The order will be thrilled that we recovered this technology.
I couldn't let your Master's sacrifice go to waste.
Glad I could help.
What happens when you return to the order?
What about you?
Continue my training. Master Bacara will be hard to replace.
You would have just gotten yourself killed.
Someone had to.
Maybe. But if Master Bacara could take that risk, so could I.
I could feel it, when Master Bacara died. When you killed the Gormak leader, I felt that too.
But it was different. It felt... good. My Master would probably tell me I sound like a Sith.
Death isn't necessarily evil. Enjoying it is.
Not yet, but close.
The sooner I can leave Voss, the better. Being here is dangerous.
Only a Sith takes pleasure in suffering.
He would be right.
Next time I'll be more mindful of my feelings. I hope there is no next time.
Soldiers have to kill. We don't have to like it.
It's tempting, I know.
Or feel it. When Master Bacara took his last breath. When the Gormak took his.
A little revenge never hurt anybody.
Jedi worry too much.
He killed Master Bacara in one shot. Didn't even slow him down.
That savage was a threat to everyone at this camp.
We had no choice.
Then it was for the greater good. Master Bacara would be proud.
Too late if you do.
This tech is too important to risk losing again. Soon as I'm healed, I'll get back to Voss-Ka.
For the order, for Master Bacara, for everything--thanks.
I can sense the Gormak leader is still alive. He must have avoided you like the rakghoul plague.
It's not right that he survived. Maybe I should stay. Wait 'til I'm healed, and find him.
Revenge is the fastest path to the dark side.
A dangerous move.
Master Bacara said it was pride. I guess it is, thinking I could win where he lost.
A Jedi uses the Force for defense, never for attack.
That's not our way.
I'm sorry, Master. I'll try to control my emotions in the future.
And get yourself killed? Your Master wouldn't want that.
Not worth your life.
You're right. This tech is my responsibility now--I have to get it back safely.
Your Master's dead. Killing this guy won't bring him back.
Let it go, kid.
I thought it might be justice. But maybe I just wanted the Gormak to pay.
He's a menace. You'd be doing the Voss a favor.
He deserves worse.
Master Bacara almost had him beat. If I can get him alone, I might have a shot.
Kill a hundred Gormak if you want. I did my part.
Your call--I'm done.
I'm still not a hundred percent healed. I'll get these items ready for transport in the meantime.
My Master died trying to protect that technology. We can't leave it to the Gormak.
A whole squad? Did the order send you? They must have finally gotten my comm call.
Master, am I glad to see you. There's so few of us here, and the Voss don't understand.
I know you. Havoc Squad. You're the best in the Republic. If anybody can help, it's you.
Wait there, you. As a citizen of the Republic, you have to help a Jedi in distress. I hope.
Padawan Kosh. My Master and I were investigating the ruins here. We discovered ancient Jedi technology inside, still working.
Finding anything Jedi on Voss is major, but finding tech in working order... the Gormak were the last thing on our minds.
Few Gormak can challenge a Jedi, let alone two.
Understandable.
Guess Master Bacara and I were just lucky enough to meet those few.
This tech must have been here for centuries.
I'd be distracted too.
Longer, if our calculations are right. Some of the items predate the Voss.
Jedi ruins aren't the Gormak's usual targets.
Seems like a safe bet.
Nothing tied to the Force is. The Mystics, the Jedi, the Sith--we're all tainted.
I'd turn my back on a Corellian pickpocket first.
Your first mistake.
Believe me, I wish being out a few creds was my only problem right now.
What's so special about this old technology?
Ancient Jedi tech?
The Force. These devices are tied to it. It's why they've lasted this long.
I'm guessing the Gormak had other ideas.
But things went south.
Most Gormak avoid the ruins--outsider stuff, taboo, you know? Not their new leader. Led his pack right inside.
They ambushed us and stole everything we'd recovered. I survived, but Master Bacara... he fought 'til the end.
The Gormak could destroy that tech or worse.
We have to act.
The "worse" part is what I'm worried about. They took it for a reason.
He was a brave man, and a true Jedi.
My sympathies.
He took out a dozen of their strongest before the leader killed him.
These are no primitive natives we're dealing with.
The Gormak are tough.
Master Bacara told me the Voss were the real danger. Now I'm not so sure.
Could have been two dead Jedi back there.
At least you're alive.
If we'd taken the Gormak together, maybe... but he told me to run.
What use is ancient Jedi technology to the Gormak?
Why attack you?
Boo-hoo.
I don't want sympathy. I want to finish what Master Bacara and I started.
Gormak tech is already dangerously advanced. We don't even know what the ancient Jedi tech is capable of.
Even if I was healed, I wouldn't last five seconds on my own. But you'd have as good a shot as Master Bacara did.
The Gormak will return that tech, or deal with me.
You can rest easy.
Glad I'm not a Gormak. Not that I'm scared of you or anything.
We owe it to your Master and the order to try.
He won't die in vain.
I just wish I could be out there with you. Maybe I can--err, maybe not.
I don't have the Force, but I do have Republic training.
Might even do better.
Maybe you'll catch them off guard. The Republic refused to get involved.
As good as a dead man, huh? Thanks, kid.
I'm not flattered.
I'm sorry, I didn't mean to... you were kidding. I knew that.
Just stop begging.
The Gormak were still deep in the ruins when I escaped. You'll have to get past them to reach our dig site.
And if you meet the Gormak leader, don't hesitate. He's a savage. He'll kill if he gets the chance.
Help yourself. [Refuse quest]
Soon as I'm healed. I just hope the Gormak haven't destroyed everything by then.
You don't have any medpacs, do you? I'm not very good at healing.
